result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D. Morrissette

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael D. Morrissette in court, in custody.  Attorney Cole in court for Michael D. Morrissette.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM.  Offer received. PLEAH scheduled. DE in person for next hearing. Bond continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Brady.  Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Brady requests adjmt. Granted. Possible plea. FPT 9/15 1030am. Bond continued.

Defendant Michael D. Morrissette appeared with Attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Brady. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant, Michael D. Morrissette, appeared with Attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Brady requests short adjournment.     DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
